page.title: 08FARMING METHODS IN PANTON
page.content: All the {PANTON}farms follow modern farming methods and due to the heavy nature of the soil, most work is car- ried on during the months of September and October following the harvesting period. Tractors are mainly in the lOO to l5O h.p. range and the implements they pull are often 2O-3O ft in width. No natural manures are used on the fields of{PANTON}today due to the lack of grazing animals kept locally so artificial fertilisers containing phosphates, potash and nitrogen are spread on the land. Crop spraying is either carried out by tractor-drawn sprayer or aeroplanes from Wickenby. Spraying is carried out for weed killing, aphid control, disease control or for feeding trace elements suh as manganese, magnesium, natural sulphur. Non-farming residents are alarmed about other effects of sprays.
